author: Kamna Revanoor
content: The Congress leadership is said to have finalised candidates for around 22 constituencies in Karnataka, including Koppal, Raichur, Belagavi, Bengaluru Rural, Vijayapura, Bagalkot, Ballari, Haveri, etc. The Congress’ Central Election Committee (CEC) chaired a meeting on Thursday, 7 March, with AICC chief Mallikarjun Kharge, former AICC chief Rahul Gandhi, and others.
title: Congress finalises candidates for 22 LS seats in Karnataka

author: Medhaa Gupta
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has said it has attached assets worth ₹50 crore of a sugar mill, which is owned by a company of former Maharashtra CM Sharad Pawar's grandnephew Rohit Pawar. Earlier, Rohit appeared before the probe agency for questioning in connection with a money laundering probe into the alleged Maharashtra State Cooperative Bank scam.
title: ₹50 cr-assets of Sharad Pawar's grandnephew's firm attached by ED

author: Daisy Mowke
content: Author-philanthropist Sudha Murty on Friday said PM Narendra Modi announcing her nomination to Rajya Sabha was a "double surprise" for her as it came on Women's Day. She added she had "absolutely no idea" why government nominated her. "This is a new area to me...I've to first sit and study and then I'll be able to do it," Murty stated.
title: Had absolutely no idea: Sudha Murty on being nominated to Rajya Sabha

author: The Hawk Editor
content: BJP, TDP, and Jana Sena, led by leaders Chandrababu Naidu, Amit Shah, and Pawan Kalyan, agree in principle to form an alliance for Andhra Pradesh's upcoming Lok Sabha and Assembly polls. Discussions are ongoing to resolve seat-sharing issues, with more talks expected to finalize the coalition.
title: BJP and TDP agree on pre-poll alliance: TDP Ravindra Kumar

author: ReferSMS Partner
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi celebrates Smt Sudha Murty's Rajya Sabha nomination, lauding her exceptional contributions to social work, philanthropy, and education. He emphasizes her nomination as a testament to 'Nari Shakti', wishing her a successful parliamentary tenure. Sudha Murty's appointment signifies the pivotal role of women in shaping India's future and policymaking processes.
title: Prime Minister Modi welcomes Sudha Murty’s rajya sabha nomination

author: Dharini Mudgal
content: Reacting to the Centre's decision to cut LPG cylinder prices by ₹100, Shiv Sena (UBT) MP Priyanka Chaturvedi said, "This is an election-driven decision as women kept demanding the same for years. Election season is the only reason." She further questioned, "Inflation is high and the deduction of ₹100, how it's a big relief."
title: Election season only reason: Chaturvedi on LPG cylinder price cut

author: ReferSMS Partner
content: Meghalaya Chief Minister Conrad K Sangma oversees the final stages of construction at the Meghalaya Legislative Assembly building in Mawdiangdiang, emphasizing readiness for inauguration. Speaker Thomas Sangma, Deputy Speaker Timothy D Shira, Deputy Chief Minister Prestone Tynsong, and Sniawbhalang Dhar accompanied him.
title: Meghalaya CM Inspects Nearly Completed Legislative Assembly

author: The Hawk Editor
content: DMK renews its 2019 election pact with VCK and MDMK for Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha polls, allocating seats within the alliance. VCK gets two reserved seats, MDMK one. The parties aim to replicate their previous success under the Secular Progressive Alliance, with DMK leading the charge for a comprehensive victory.
title: DMK finalizes seat sharing with VCK, MDMK for TN upcoming election

author: Dharini Mudgal
content: Philanthropist Sudha Murty expressed her happiness on being nominated to Rajya Sabha. Murty thanked PM Narendra Modi for the nomination and said, "It's a big Women's Day gift to me. It's a new responsibility to work for the country." She said, "I'll work my level best. I'm happy that I am getting a bigger platform to work for the poor."
title: A big Women's Day gift to me: Sudha Murty on Rajya Sabha nomination

author: Dharini Mudgal
content: Nazim Nazir, a government scheme beneficiary, spoke about his meeting with Prime Minister Narendra Modi during the latter's visit to Srinagar. He said, "I’m delighted after clicking...selfie with...PM. It's not a small thing for me. I also hugged him and exchanged...handshake." PM Modi also posted his picture with Nazim on X and wrote, "A memorable selfie with my friend Nazim."
title: It's not a small thing: Govt scheme beneficiary on meeting PM Modi
